results.title: Dandenong
results.brief_description: A walk down memory lane in this black and white 1950s footage of the Dandenong Trades Exhibition which includes shots of white goods, furniture and TVs, Holden cars, streetscape images and a fashion parade. Also shows a blind woman working swiftly to create a bristle scrubbing brush. Athol Adams footage is courtesy of Jenny and Owen Peake.

results.title: Carmel: storyteller
results.brief_description: Carmel is a retired school teacher, wife, mother and grandmother. Her family’ s life dramatically changed when she was diagnosed with early onset memory loss. With her husband, she tells their story and looks positively in the face of an unknown future. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: La partria o la tumba
results.brief_description: Socialist parents, rebellious children - it runs in the blood. Esteban’s parents originally came from Uruguay but were forced to flee to Australia in 1974 from the ruling military regime. His father, aged 32, and mother, aged 21, eventually settled in Melbourne raising four children and establishing the first South American bakery, in Yarraville. In this story, Esteban talks of his family’s experiences and his deep respect for his wonderful rebellious parents.

results.title: Ron's story
results.brief_description: A wife remembers her wonderful life with her husband, who can now no longer remember it with her. Created as part of the ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ workshop, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with Alzheimer’s Australia Vic and in partnership with VicHealth.

results.title: Simmo, the man I love
results.brief_description: John’s reputation as a great pilot earned him the respect of his colleagues, especially one admirer, Yolanta. But towards the end of his career, it felt like he was losing his touch, something was wrong. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

group.title: Memory's voice: capturing stories of courage

results.title: Heart of Otara
results.brief_description: Otara has the reputation as one of the most dangerous places in New Zealand. But for Sami, who now lives in Australia, Otara will always remain in his heart as home, as the land of his father and his family. Proud of his color and proud of his culture, Sami talks of his memories as a child, the good times and the bad including the tragic circumstances which eventually led to a new start and a new beginning in Australia. Music composed by Sami Laga.

results.title: Rain check on Christmas
results.brief_description: A father and his daughter re-tell the events that happened two days before Christmas, when the father was struck down with a heart attack. Made as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’ in association with Vic Health and the Heart Foundation.

results.title: A Letter for Marie
results.brief_description: South African born Marie has been diagnosed with Alzheimer’s disease. Her husband, Tom, speaks of their 33-years together and of the good times still to come. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Health and the Alzheimer’s Association.

results.title: Vessel
results.creator_credit: Simryn Gill, ACMI and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Simryn Gill’s languid mini-series stills the television screen, her camera framing a simple fishing boat and its passage, in real time, across the horizon.

results.title: Memories for mum
results.brief_description: Since emigrating from Malta in the 60’s, Tess and her husband have faced many challenges living in Australia and raising their boys. As Tess is now suffering from Alzheimer’s disease, her husband and sons pay tribute to a truly great woman. Created as part of ‘Memory’s Voice: Capturing Stories of Courage’ in association with Vic Helath and the Alzheimer’s Association.
